instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PBUS_G3H: What is PBUS_G3H? This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H When you see PBUS_G3H, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.820-3453: What is 820-3453? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.5V_S4: What is 5V_S4? This is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S4” – when you see this, assume the person typing it meant to type “PP5V_S4”.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message: This board had a short on it which was resolved by replacing <CAPACITOR>C7371</CAPACITOR>. Now I still have no power but on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> I have 500mV and slowly rising up to 1+V. Never seen behavior like that so not sure what to do or go after next. Checked all points for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> they all show the same number. When I disconnect power and a minute later reconnect it, it picks up where it left off, only dropping a few mV so the charge is being kept somewhere, just don't understand the behavior.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message: Check resistance between pins 17/18 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. Also this machine should run from a charged battery is problem is simply with the ISL circuit.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message: 2.3 Ohm between 17/18, 19.8 Ohm between 27/28. No power from battery but according to the magsafe when connected it is still charging, percentage unknown.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message: Unless the battery is known good and holds a charge this is no help. What is resistance to GND on PPBUS? Is the PPBUS fuse good? DCIN on <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> getting power?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message: Resistance to GND on PPBUS is 25 kOhm and climbing. Fuse (F7700) is good. DCIN on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> is 14.38V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message: Green/orange light present? Getting DCIN on <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message: 14.30V on all pins of <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>. Magsafe light is orange.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message: Where are you measuring PPBUS? Measure on the coil before the fuse? Is the fuse popped?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message: I measured all the points the BV highlighted when I searched <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, a coil is not shown as one of those points. I also can't find a coil before the fuse in the schematic. The fuse is good though.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message:
You are maybe looking at F7700 whitch is another fuse for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> near backlight circuit.

There is another fuse right in the begining of <SIGNAL>PBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> it's F7140, and before this fuse there is a coil L7130, check the fuse and measure PPBUS on the coil and the fuse.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message:
jadao and dukefawkes I will check on your suggestions in a moment. 

I found that F7140 was bad so replaced it, now get same 8.6V on both sides. Re-measuring the G3H line I run into a dead end at <TRANSISTOR>Q5500</TRANSISTOR>, I think. It has the right voltage coming in but is not shooting out PBUS S0 VSENSE to the SMC. The enable signal is coming in at 8.38V which is correct as far as I can tell.

L7130 gives me 8.6V on both sides.
F7700 also 8.6V on both sides.

Going to look for a <TRANSISTOR>Q5500</TRANSISTOR> replacement and report back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8,6v is present and you have green/orange light, you should go further by checking other power rails.
do you have S5 power rails, S4, S3?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q5500</TRANSISTOR> is just for voltage sensing and has nothing to do with power on.
So the PPBUS issue was a simple dead fuse, which makes sense after a short on that rail. Is the green/orange light present now? <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message:
Started measuring rails from scratch and hit a dead end at <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>.
Leading this all the way back to the DC board of which I have tried 3, all resulting in no power.
I have no schematic for the DC board (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3453</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) but there's a Cap that measures 14.87V on one side and 0V on the other side.... on all 3 of my DC boards. Don't know if that's OK or if all 3 of my boards are now f'd.

Attached is a picture.

Orange/green light still present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message: Are there DC boards from other models that are compatible?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message: About the cap, of course you will have voltaje on one side because is in the + line and the other side is GND....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
threads.message:
Don't even need an IO board, these boards will power on without a green light so connecting only the power cable is enough. No need to plug in the flat cable.

No S4 can be absolutely anything and this board has history so it could be any knocked off component. As this was not water damage, physical damage is the most likely suspect. See if the <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL> rail is pulsing, check PPVRTC.
